page.description: Assign a null value to any type.
page.discussion: NULL_VALUE() is used in an Update Operation or an Xbasic script to assign NULL to a field or variable.
page.example: dim t as P t = table.open("orders") t.change_begin() t.date = NULL_VALUE() t.change_end(.T.) t.close()

section.description: Note : Numeric variables are a special case. You cannot use NULL_VALUE() with a numeric variable. However, if you have a numeric field, you can set the field value to NULL_VALUE().
section.example: dim t as P t = table.open("journal") ? t.PERIOD_YEAR = 34 t.change_begin() t.PERIOD_YEAR = NULL_VALUE() t.change_end(.t.) t.close() ? t.PERIOD_YEAR = 0
